Data.event_text: 9 January  Gabriel Attal becomes the youngest and first openly gay Prime Minister of France.

links.text: -"Gabriel Attal: Macron's pick for PM is France's youngest at 34". 2024-01-09. Retrieved 2024-01-09.-

Data.event_text: 18 January  2024 French farmers' protests are held against French and EU agricultural policy.

links.text: -""On va mener une action qui va marquer les esprits": les agriculteurs veulent bloquer les autoroutes ce jeudi" (in French). ladepeche.fr. Retrieved 2024-01-24.-
-"Colère des agriculteurs : les revendications de la profession" (in French). L'Express. 2024-01-24. Retrieved 2024-01-24.-

Data.event_text: 23 January  A woman is killed while her husband and their daughter, all FNSEA members, are injured after a car crashes into a roadblock in Pamiers at the 2024 French farmers' protests.

links.text: -"A woman dies and 2 people are injured at a French farmers' protest barricade". AP News. 2024-01-23. Retrieved 2024-01-23.-

Data.event_text: 26 January  Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and French President Emmanuel Macron celebrate India's Republic Day together, with Macron being the Chief Guest at the Republic Day parade in New Delhi.

links.text: -"Republic Day 2024: Emmanuel Macron chief guest, parade time, other key details conviction". Hindustan Times. Retrieved 26 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28 January  Protesters advocating for sustainable food throw soup at the Mona Lisa in the Louvre. The painting is protected by bulletproof glass and is undamaged.

links.text: -"Mona Lisa: Protesters throw soup at da Vinci painting". 2024-01-28. Retrieved 2024-01-28.-

Data.event_text: 10 February  Électricité de France shuts down two nuclear reactors due to a fire at the Chinon Nuclear Power Plant.

links.text: -"France's EDF shuts down two nuclear reactors after fire at Chinon plant". Yahoo Finance. 2024-02-10. Retrieved 2024-02-10.-

Data.event_text: 21 February  Entry of Missak Manouchian and Mélinée Manouchian into the Panthéon.

links.text: -"Missak Manouchian, héros de la Résistance d'origine arménienne, va faire son entrée au Panthéon" [Missak Manouchian, hero of the Resistance of Armenian origin, will enter the Panthéon]. Le Monde (in French). 28 June 2023. Retrieved 3 November 2023.-

Data.event_text: 19 April  A man is arrested after threatening to blow himself up near the Iranian Embassy in Paris.

links.text: -Roeloffs, Mary Whitfill. "Man Reportedly Threatened To Blow Himself Up Near Iranian Embassy In Paris". Forbes. Retrieved 2024-04-19.-

Data.event_text: 22 April  Kendji Girac, the winner of the 2014 series of The Voice la plus belle voix, is shot in Biscarrosse.

links.text: -"Kendji Girac: The Voice France star seriously hurt after shooting". BBC News. 2024-04-22. Retrieved 2024-04-22.-

Data.event_text: 24 April  The union representing air traffic controllers in France cancels a planned 24-hour strike, although a majority of flights had already been cancelled.

links.text: -"France airport strike called off but flights still cancelled". euronews. 2024-04-23. Retrieved 2024-04-25.-

Data.event_text: Chinese President Xi Jinping begins his European tour, starting in France, Serbia and ending in Hungary.

links.text: -"Xi Jinping to Pay State Visits to France, Serbia and Hungary". www.fmprc.gov.cn. Archived from the original on 29 April 2024. Retrieved May 6, 2024.-
-"Xi Jinping to Pay State Visits to France, Serbia and Hungary". www.fmprc.gov.cn. Archived from the original on 29 April 2024. Retrieved May 6, 2024.-
-"China's Xi to visit France, Serbia and Hungary May 5–10, foreign ministry says". Reuters. Retrieved May 6, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28  2024 New Caledonia unrest – A state of emergency is declared in New Caledonia after riots break out amid debate over a proposed electoral reform in the territory. Six people, including a police officer are killed, and at least 60 others are injured.

links.text: -"Violence rages in New Caledonia as France rushes emergency reinforcements to its Pacific territory". Associated Press. Retrieved May 16, 2024.-
-"French authorities report a sixth fatality in New Caledonia violence". Associated Press. Retrieved May 18, 2024.-
-"France to lift state of emergency in riot-hit New Caledonia". France 24. 27 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: Two prison officers are killed in an attack on a van carrying inmate Mohamed Amra near Rouen that results in his escape.

links.text: -"France prison van attack: Two officers killed in ambush near Normandy". BBC. Retrieved May 14, 2024.-

Data.event_text: The 77th annual Cannes Film Festival opens in Cannes, with an honorary Palme d'Or award for Meryl Streep.

links.text: -"Cannes kicks off with Greta Gerwig's jury and a Palme d'Or for Meryl Streep". AP News. 2024-05-14. Retrieved 2024-05-14.-

Data.event_text: An armed man is shot dead by police in Rouen after he threatens to attack a synagogue.

links.text: -"French police fatally shoot a man suspected of planning to set fire to a synagogue". Associated Press. Retrieved May 17, 2024.-

Data.event_text: The exclusive Harry Winston boutique in Paris is targeted in an armed robbery that results in the loss of “several million euros’” worth of items.

links.text: -"Robbers made off with 'several million euros' of jewels in armed heist of 'Jeweler to the Stars'". Associated Press. Retrieved May 20, 2024.-

Data.event_text: An 18-year old man from Chechnya is arrested on suspicion of plotting an attack on a football match at the Stade Geoffroy-Guichard in Saint-Etienne during the 2024 Paris Olympics.

links.text: -"French security authorities foil a plan to attack soccer events during the Paris Olympics". Associated Press. Retrieved May 31, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Staff at France Médias Monde, France Télévisions and Radio France go on strike in protest against plans for a merger of the public broadcasting sector proposed by Culture Minister Rachida Dati.

links.text: -"FRANCE 24 news coverage disrupted as staff strike against public media merger". France 24. Retrieved May 23, 2024.-

Data.event_text: France bans Israeli defense firms from exhibiting at Eurosatory.

links.text: -"France bans Israeli defense firms from prestigious arms show amid Gaza ceasefire call". The Times of Israel. May 31, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 3 June  A Russian-Ukrainian national is arrested north of Paris and subsequently charged with plotting a bomb attack and other terrorism offences.

links.text: -"A Russian-Ukrainian man is suspected of plotting a terrorist bombing in France". Associated Press. 2024-06-08. Retrieved 2024-06-08.-

Data.event_text: 4 June  Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov warns that French military instructors will be "legitimate targets" if they are deployed to Ukraine.

links.text: -"French military instructors in Ukraine would be 'legitimate target', Russia says". France 24. 2024-06-04. Retrieved 2024-06-05.-

Data.event_text: Commemoration of the 80th anniversary of the D-Day landings.

links.text: -"1944 – 2024: 80TH ANNIVERSARY OF D-DAY AND THE BATTLE OF NORMANDY". Normandy Tourism. 25 October 2023. Retrieved 3 November 2023.-

Data.event_text: The Investigative Committee of Russia announces the arrest of a French national in Moscow on suspicion of failing to register with authorities as a foreign agent and collecting information on the Russian military.

links.text: -"French citizen arrested in Moscow on charges of collecting military data". Associated Press. 6 June 2024. Retrieved 2024-06-06.-

Data.event_text: President Macron announces that the country will send Dassault Mirage 2000-5 fighter aircraft to Ukraine and train its pilots by the end of 2024.

links.text: -Smith, Benedict (2024-06-06). "France will start selling Mirage fighter jets to Ukraine 'by end of year'". The Telegraph. ISSN 0307-1235. Retrieved 2024-06-07.-
-Smith, Benedict (2024-06-06). "France will start selling Mirage fighter jets to Ukraine 'by end of year'". The Telegraph. ISSN 0307-1235. Retrieved 2024-06-07.-

Data.event_text: After the National Rally emerges as the largest party in the French contingent during the 2024 European Parliament election, President Macron dissolves the National Assembly and announces snap parliamentary elections on 30 June and 7 July.

links.text: -"Here's what happened in some key countries in the EU Parliament elections". Associated Press. 2024-06-09. Retrieved 2024-06-10.-

Data.event_text: 2024 French Open In tennis, Carlos Alcaraz wins the Men's singles title at the French Open after defeating Alexander Zverev in the final, earning his third Grand Slam title.

links.text: -"Carlos Alcaraz wins the French Open for a third Grand Slam title at 21 by beating Alexander Zverev". AP News. 2024-06-09. Retrieved 2024-06-10.-

Data.event_text: 10 June  The Chanel branch in Paris' Avenue Montaigne is targeted by a car-ramming attack as part of a robbery.

links.text: -"Thieves ram-raid Chanel store in Paris". www.france24.com. 2024-06-10. Retrieved 2024-06-10.-

Data.event_text: The president of The Republicans, Éric Ciotti, speaks in favor of an alliance with the National Rally during an interview with TF1. Olivier Marleix, the head of the party in the National Assembly, calls for Ciotti's resignation in response.

links.text: -Kirby, Paul (11 June 2024). "French right uproar over call for far-right alliance". BBC. Retrieved 12 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: France's left wing political parties form a New Popular Front ahead of the parliamentary elections.

links.text: -"French left agrees to form new 'Popular Front' in parliamentary elections". Le Monde.fr. 2024-06-11. Retrieved 2024-06-11.-

Data.event_text: 12 June  2024 The Republicans crisis  The Republicans votes unanimously to remove its leader Éric Ciotti for attempting to form an electoral alliance with Marine Le Pen's far-right National Rally. On 14 June, a Paris court reviews the decision and rules in Ciotti's favor.

links.text: -"France's rightwing Les Républicains vote out leader Éric Ciotti over election pact with far right". France 24. 12 June 2024. Retrieved 12 June 2024.-
-"France's conservative Republicans kick out party chief Ciotti". Reuters. 12 June 2024. Retrieved 12 June 2024.-
-"Court suspends French right-wing leader Ciotti's expulsion from party". Le Monde. 14 June 2024. Retrieved 14 June 2024.-
-"Paris court overturns decision to expel Ciotti as head of France's right-wing Les Républicains". France 24. 14 June 2024. Retrieved 14 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 15 June  Over 600,000 people march in Paris and other cities nationwide to protest against the far-right National Rally.

links.text: -"French protesters are standing up to the far right ahead of the country's snap elections". AP News. 2024-06-15. Retrieved 2024-06-15.-

Data.event_text: 16 June  2024 24 Hours of Le Mans In endurance racing, the AF Corse Ferrari team wins the 24 Hours of Le Mans for the second consecutive year, with drivers Antonio Fuoco, Miguel Molina, and Nicklas Nielsen.

links.text: -"Ferrari defends crown at 24 Hours of Le Mans". ESPN.com. 2024-06-16. Retrieved 2024-06-16.-

Data.event_text: The European Commission reprimands Belgium, France, Hungary, Italy, Malta, Poland, and Slovakia for breaking budget rules.

links.text: -"European Commission reprimands France and six countries for breaking budget rules". Le Monde.fr. 2024-06-19. Retrieved 2024-06-19.-

Data.event_text: Two teenagers are charged with the gang rape of a 12-year-old Jewish girl in Courbevoie, in an attack suspected to have been motivated by anti-Semitism.

links.text: -"Two French boys charged with antisemitic rape of 12-year-old girl". June 19, 2024.-

Data.event_text: One person is killed by police after stabbing two people with a screwdriver in Aubervilliers.

links.text: -"French police shoot dead an attacker with a screwdriver in Paris suburbs". Associated Press. June 19, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 June  France reports nearly 200 cases of cholera in Mayotte.

links.text: -Presse, AFP-Agence France. "France Reports Nearly 200 Cholera Cases In Mayotte". www.barrons.com. Retrieved 2024-06-22.-

Data.event_text: 23 June  2024 New Caledonia unrest Independence leader Christian Tein and seven other activists are flown to France for pre-trial detention after being arrested for inciting violence and riots in New Caledonia.

links.text: -"New Caledonia independence activists sent to France for detention". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-06-24.-

Data.event_text: 26 June  The French government orders the dissolution of the far-right Groupe Union Défense and several other far-right and Islamic extremist groups, citing risks of violence.

links.text: -"France bans extreme-right and radical Islamic groups ahead of polarizing elections". Associated Press. 26 June 2024. Retrieved 2024-06-26.-

Data.event_text: 29 June  One person is killed and five others are injured following a shooting at a wedding hall in Thionville.

links.text: -"One dead, five injured in France wedding hall attack". RTL. Retrieved 2024-06-30.-

Data.event_text: 2024 French legislative election Voters select candidates in the first round of legislative elections for the 17th National Assembly.
Thousands of left-wing protesters gather in cities across France to protest the National Rally's lead in election polls, while showing support for the New Popular Front.

links.text: -"Thousands gather in Paris square to protest far-right National Rally party". France 24. 2024-06-30. Retrieved 2024-07-01.-

Data.event_text: 3 July  Prisca Thevenot, Spokesperson of the Government of France and Renaissance candidate for Hauts-de-Seine's 8th constituency is attacked along with a supporter while putting up campaign posters in Meudon. Several suspects are arrested.

links.text: -"France's government spokesperson is attacked on the campaign trail, days before decisive election". Associated Press. 4 July 2024. Retrieved 4 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 4 July   Film director Benoît Jacquot is charged with the rapes of actresses Julia Roy and Isild Le Besco between 1998 and 2000, and "rape, sexual assault and violence" committed between 2013 and 2018.

links.text: -"French film director Jacquot charged with rape". Le Monde.fr. 2024-07-03. Retrieved 2024-07-05.-

Data.event_text: No party wins a majority in the National Assembly, with the left-wing New Popular Front gaining a plurality of seats and the far-right National Rally coming in third place.

links.text: -"What just happened in France's shock election?". BBC News. 8 July 2024. Retrieved 2024-07-08.-

Data.event_text: Prime Minister Gabriel Attal announces that he will resign effective . However, his resignation is rejected on that day by President Macron, who asks him to remain in office "for the time being".

links.text: -"French PM Attal: I will hand my resignation on Monday morning". Reuters. July 7, 2024.-
-"Macron asks French PM to stay on as political deadlock continues". BBC. July 8, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 11 July  A fire damages the spire of the 11th-century Rouen Cathedral during restoration. No further damage or injuries are reported.

links.text: -"Relief in Rouen as cathedral fire extinguished". Reuters. July 11, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 12 July  A new political party L'Après is founded by dissidents from La France Insoumise.

links.text: -"Launch of "L'après", the new movement of dissident rebels – Interview". 2024-07-13. Retrieved 2024-07-13.-

Data.event_text: 13 July  Three people are killed and four injured after a mass shooting at a birthday party in Espinasse-Vozelle. The perpetrator commits suicide.

links.text: -"Une fusillade fait 4 morts dans l'Allier : "On est loin de penser qu'un jour on va vivre un tel événement"". France 3 Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes (in French). 2024-07-14. Retrieved 2024-07-14.-

Data.event_text: 15 July  A soldier is injured in a knife attack while on patrol at the Gare de l'Est station in Paris. The perpetrator is arrested.

links.text: -"Attacker stabs and wounds French soldier patrolling Paris ahead of the Olympics". Associated Press. 2024-07-16. Retrieved 2024-07-16.-

Data.event_text: 16 July  President Macron approves the resignation of Prime Minister Attal and his cabinet, but maintains Attal as head of a transitional caretaker government.

links.text: -"French president accepts prime minister's resignation but keeps him as head of caretaker government". AP News. 2024-07-16. Retrieved 2024-07-16.-

Data.event_text: 17 July  An 18-year old man is arrested in Bas-Rhin on suspicion of plotting attacks inspired by far-right extremism during the Paris Olympics.

links.text: -"French security services arrest far-right extremist over suspected Paris Olympics plot". France 24. 2024-07-17. Retrieved 2024-07-17.-

Data.event_text: Seven people are killed in a suspected arson attack on an apartment in Nice.

links.text: -"Suspected arson attack in Nice kills 7 including children". BBC. 2024-07-18. Retrieved 2024-07-18.-

Data.event_text: A police officer is injured in a knife attack along the Champs-Elysees in Paris. The assailant is shot dead.

links.text: -"A police officer has been wounded in a knife attack in Paris. The attacker was killed by police". Associated Press. 2024-07-19. Retrieved 2024-07-19.-

Data.event_text: 22 July  President Macron opens the 142nd IOC Session in Paris.

links.text: -"'We are ready', Macron says as France gears up for Paris Olympics amid tight security". France 24. 2024-07-21. Retrieved 2024-07-22.-

Data.event_text: La France Insoumise introduces legislation to reverse pension changes and revert the legal retirement age to 62 years, with the National Rally offering support for the advancement of the legislation.

links.text: -"French leftists announce legislative steps to scrap Macron's pension reform". Reuters. July 23, 2024.-

Data.event_text: A Russian national is arrested on suspicion of plotting acts of "destabilisation" during the Paris Olympics.

links.text: -"French police arrest Russian suspected of plotting Paris Olympics 'destabilisation'". France 24. 2024-07-24. Retrieved 2024-07-24.-

Data.event_text: 24 July  At the International Olympic Committee session before the start of the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, it is announced that the French Alps region has been conditionally approved to host the 2030 Winter Olympics.

links.text: -"Salt Lake City celebrates announcement that Winter Olympics will return in 2034". Associated Press. 2024-07-24. Retrieved 2024-07-24.-

Data.event_text: 2024 France railway arson attack A series of attacks are staged on the infrastructure of the TGV and Eurostar rail networks, resulting in damage and cancellations.

links.text: -"French rail network hit by 'malicious acts' ahead of Paris Olympics". Al Jazeera. 2024-07-26. Retrieved 2024-07-26.-
-"Eurostar cancels quarter of train services ahead of Olympics after arson attacks on French railway". CNBC. 26 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: The opening ceremonies of the 2024 Summer Olympics take place on the bank of the River Seine and the Jardins du Trocadéro in Paris.

links.text: -"Opening Ceremony: Olympic flame rises over Paris as Céline Dion sings Edith Piaf". France 24. 2024-07-26. Retrieved 11 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: French police arrest a far-left extremist who may have been behind an attack on the long-distance train network ahead of the opening of the 2024 Olympic Games in Paris.

links.text: -"French police arrest far-left suspect after rail sabotage – DW – 07/29/2024". dw.com. Retrieved 2024-07-29.-

Data.event_text: French police report multiple sabotage acts targeting telecommunications operators across six areas of the country, affecting 11,000 clients. The incidents are treated as vandalism. No one has been arrested and no group has claimed responsibility.

links.text: -"France: Telecom fiber optic networks sabotaged – DW – 07/29/2024". dw.com. Retrieved 2024-07-29.-

Data.event_text: Olympic organisers cancel the second session of triathlon training due to water quality concerns in the Seine.

links.text: -"Olympics organisers cancel second triathlon training over Seine water quality". France 24. 2024-07-29. Retrieved 2024-07-29.-

Data.event_text: Algeria withdraws its ambassador from France after the latter declares its support for the Western Sahara Autonomy Proposal, which was proposed by Morocco in 2007.

links.text: -"Algeria recalls ambassador after France backs Moroccan plan for Western Sahara". RFI. 2024-07-30. Retrieved 2024-07-31.-

Data.event_text: Olympic officials postpone the men's individual triathlon race due to poor water quality levels in the Seine river.

links.text: -Liakos, Homero De la Fuente, Kyle Feldscher, Chris (2024-07-30). "Olympic officials postpone men's triathlon due to pollution in the Seine". CNN. Retrieved 2024-07-31.{{cite web}}:  CS1 maint: multiple names: authors list (link)-

Data.event_text: Several athletes test positive for COVID-19, including Australian swimmer Lani Pallister, forcing her to withdraw from the 1500 metre freestyle swimming event.

links.text: -"COVID-19 looms over 2024 Paris Olympics with several athletes testing positive". July 30, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 7 August  French police detain Australian field hockey player Tom Craig for allegedly purchasing cocaine.

links.text: -"Olympics: Australian arrested for allegedly buying cocaine". dw.com. Retrieved 2024-08-07.-

Data.event_text: 9 August  French police arrest Egyptian wrestler Mohamed Ibrahim El-Sayed in Paris for alleged sexual assault.

links.text: -"Paris 2024 Olympics: Egypt wrestler Mohamed 'Kesho' Ibrahim arrested for alleged sexual assault". BBC Sport. 2024-08-09. Retrieved 2024-08-09.-

Data.event_text: 11 August  The closing ceremonies of the 2024 Summer Olympics take place at the Stade de France.

links.text: -"'Sensational' Paris Olympics come to an end". BBC News. 11 August 2024. Retrieved 11 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 14 August  Two pilots are killed following a midair collision between two Dassault Rafale fighter jets of the French Air Force over Colombey-les-Belles.

links.text: -"Two fighter jet pilots die in France after mid-air crash". The Guardian. 15 August 2024. Retrieved 15 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 16 August  A Fouga CM.170 Magister crashes into the Mediterranean Sea off the coast of Le Lavandou during an air show, killing its pilot.

links.text: -"Pilot dies when plane crashes during air show in France". The Brussels Times. 17 August 2024. Retrieved 17 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 August  A man is shot and injured by police after setting fire to the town hall of Angoulême.

links.text: -"French police shoot man who set fire to Angoulême town hall". France 24. 22 August 2024. Retrieved 22 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: Two cars explode in an arson attack on a synagogue in La Grande-Motte, injuring a police officer. A 33-year old Algerian suspect who was seen wrapped in a Palestinian flag following the attack is injured after resisting arrest in Nîmes.

links.text: -"French police arrest synagogue blast suspect". BBC. 25 August 2024. Retrieved 25 August 2024.-
-Greyman-Kennard, Danielle; Green, Eyal. "Suspect arrested for terror attack outside French synagogue causing car explosion, one injured". The Jerusalem Post. Retrieved 27 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov is arrested at ParisLe Bourget Airport. On 28 , prosecutors formally indict him with complicity in distribution of child exploitation media and drug trafficking and ban him from leaving France.

links.text: -"Telegram messaging app CEO Pavel Durov arrested at French airport". France 24. 25 August 2024. Retrieved 25 August 2024.-
-"Telegram CEO Charged for Alleged Criminal Use of App". Bloomberg. 2024-08-28. Retrieved 2024-08-29.-

Data.event_text: The New Popular Front shuts down future talks with President Macron to break political deadlock after Macron refuses to implement a leftist-led coalition government despite the NFP receiving the most votes and calls for nationwide protests against Macron's "parody of democracy".

links.text: -"France's Macron back to square one as left plans protests over political crisis". Reuters. August 27, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28 August  8 September 2024 Summer Paralympics.

links.text: -"Highlights from the opening ceremony of the Paralympic Games in Paris". Associated Press. 29 August 2024. Retrieved 29 August 2024.-
-"Paralympics closing ceremony has Paris partying". BBC. 8 September 2024. Retrieved 9 September 2024.-

Data.event_text: 29 August  Serbia and French aerospace manufacturer Dassault Aviation sign an agreement for the purchase of 12 Dassault Rafale warplanes.

links.text: -"France, Serbia sign Rafale fighter jet deal during Macron visit". 2024-08-29. Retrieved 2024-08-30.-

Data.event_text: 3 September  A boat carrying migrants breaks apart in the English Channel off the coast of Le Portel, killing at least 12 passengers. Sixty-five others are rescued.

links.text: -"A boat with dozens of migrants rips apart in the English Channel off France, killing 12". Associated Press. 3 September 2024. Retrieved 2024-09-03.-

Data.event_text: 5 September  Michel Barnier is named the Prime Minister of France, two months after legislative elections in July.

links.text: -White, Sarah (5 September 2024). "Michel Barnier appointed French prime minister". Financial Times. Retrieved 2024-09-05.-

Data.event_text: 7 September  Nationwide protests against President Macron's appointment of Michel Barnier as the prime minister break out in 130 cities and towns nationwide, with the New Popular Front claiming that Macron stole the June and July parliamentary election.

links.text: -"Thousands protest in France against Macron's choice of prime minister". Reuters. September 7, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 10 September  Four climbers from Italy and South Korea are found dead on the French side of Mont Blanc after being reported missing on 7 September.

links.text: -"2 Italian and 2 South Korean climbers are found dead close to Mont Blanc's summit". Associated Press. 10 September 2024. Retrieved 2024-09-11.-

Data.event_text: 15 September  A boat carrying migrants breaks apart in the English Channel off the coast of Ambleteuse, killing at least eight passengers. Fifty-one others are rescued.

links.text: -"Eight migrants die in Channel crossing attempt". France 24. 15 September 2024. Retrieved 2024-09-15.-

Data.event_text: 1617 September  At least seven people, including six police officers, are injured during protests against high living costs in Martinique.

links.text: -"Gunfire injures 6 police officers in Martinique during protests over living costs". Associated Press. 17 September 2024. Retrieved 2024-09-18.-

Data.event_text: 1819 September  Two people are killed in an operation by security forces against pro-independence activists in Saint-Louis, New Caledonia.

links.text: -"2 killed in restive New Caledonia during a French police operation". Associated Press. 19 September 2024. Retrieved 2024-09-19.-

Data.event_text: 20 September  Murder of Philippine Le Noir de Carlan.

links.text: -Gunning, Fatima (2024-10-01). "Anger in France as murder suspect revealed to be convicted rapist under deportation order". Gript. Retrieved 2024-12-05.-

Data.event_text: 21 September  President Macron presents the Barnier government, mostly composed of centrist and right-wing figures.

links.text: -"France gets a more right-wing government after weeks of uncertainty". France 24. 21 September 2024. Retrieved 2024-09-22.-

Data.event_text: 23 September  The Government sends the Compagnies Républicaines de Sécurité elite riot police to Martinique for the first time since 1959, following resistance from cost of living and social inequality protesters against bans on demonstrations issued by Paris.

links.text: -"Long-forbidden French anti-riot force sent to Martinique as thousands defy bans on protests". AP News. 2024-09-22. Retrieved 2024-09-23.-

Data.event_text: 25 September  The Barnier government expresses willingness to work with the National Rally's proposals to toughen immigration and crime laws following the murder of a 19-year-old woman in Paris by a Moroccan national.

links.text: -"After student murder, France's new government heeds far right's call to be tougher on immigration". Reuters. September 25, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Prime Minister Barnier announces a one-year postponement of provincial elections in New Caledonia that were previously scheduled in December 2024.

links.text: -"France's new premier postpones election in restive Pacific territory of New Caledonia". Associated Press. 1 October 2024. Retrieved 2024-10-01.-

Data.event_text: Exiled Azerbaijani opposition activist Vidadi Isgandarli dies from wounds sustained in an attack inside his apartment in Mulhouse on 29 September.

links.text: -"France must fully probe Azerbaijani dissident's killing: Amnesty". France 24. 3 October 2024. Retrieved 2024-10-03.-

Data.event_text: 3 October  Peter Cherif, an associate of the perpetrators of the Charlie Hebdo shooting in 2015, is sentenced to life imprisonment on terrorism charges.

links.text: -"French jihadist linked to Charlie Hebdo attackers sentenced to life in prison". France 24. 3 October 2024. Retrieved 2024-10-04.-

Data.event_text: 4 October  The Court of Justice of the European Union overturns decrees by the French government banning manufacturers of plant-based meats from labeling their products as meat products, citing the lack of legal definitions.

links.text: -"EU court blocks French ban on vegetable 'steak' labelling". France 24. 5 October 2024. Retrieved 2024-10-05.-

Data.event_text: 7 October  Nearly a dozen police officers and several demonstrators are injured in renewed protests in Fort-de-France, Martinique.

links.text: -"Nearly a dozen police injured in fresh protests in Martinique". Associated Press. 8 October 2024. Retrieved 2024-10-08.-

Data.event_text: Three people are arrested in the Toulouse area on suspicion of plotting terrorist attacks.

links.text: -"French anti-terror investigators make 3 arrests in probe of suspected attack plot". Associated Press. 8 October 2024. Retrieved 2024-10-08.-

Data.event_text: The Barnier government survives a no-confidence motion filed by the New Popular Front.

links.text: -"France's minority government survives a no-confidence vote, 2 weeks after taking office". Associated Press. 9 October 2024. Retrieved 2024-10-09.-

Data.event_text: One person is killed in Sète due to extreme weather caused by Ex-Hurricane Kirk.

links.text: -"Hurricane Kirk remnants reach France, leaving at least one dead". France 24. 10 October 2024. Retrieved 2024-10-10.-

Data.event_text: One person is killed during protests in Martinique.

links.text: -"One killed as protests over high cost of living in Martinique turn violent". Associated Press. 11 October 2024. Retrieved 2024-10-11.-

Data.event_text: 10 October  Protesters occupy the tarmac of Martinique Aimé Césaire International Airport overnight and try to enter the terminal, disrupting several flights and trapping hundreds of passengers. Authorities also declare a ban on protests in the territory.

links.text: -"Martinique's airport briefly closes after violent protesters overrun the tarmac". Associated Press. 11 October 2024. Retrieved 11 October 2024.-
-"Martinique authorities ban protests following deadly riots over rising prices". France 24. 11 October 2024. Retrieved 11 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 12 October  A Tesla car crashes into a road sign and catches fire near Niort, killing all four people on board.

links.text: -"A Tesla car crashes and catches fire in France, killing 4". Associated Press. 14 October 2024. Retrieved 14 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 17 October  France becomes the first European Union member state to grant asylum to military deserters without travel documents or foreign passports after it grants visas to six Russian soldiers seeking to avoid service in Ukraine.

links.text: -"In EU first, France grants visas to six Russian soldiers who deserted Ukraine war". France 24. 17 October 2024. Retrieved 17 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 October  A nationwide manhunt is launched for the parents of a 17-day-old premature infant boy abducted from a hospital in Seine-Saint-Denis. The infant is found in Amsterdam, where his parents are also arrested.

links.text: -"French police search for a 17-day-old baby abducted from maternity ward". Associated Press. 22 October 2024. Retrieved 22 October 2024.-
-"A prematurely born baby snatched from a French maternity is doing well". Associated Press. 26 October 2024. Retrieved 26 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 25 October  The entirety of Guadeloupe loses electricity after striking workers shut down the main Électricité de France station in the territory.

links.text: -"Striking workers cut power across all of French territory Guadeloupe". France 24. 25 October 2024. Retrieved 26 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 1 November  Five people are injured in a shooting at a restaurant in Poitiers, sparking a mass brawl involving up to 600 people.

links.text: -"France shooting injures five and sparks mass brawl". BBC. 1 November 2024. Retrieved 2024-11-01.-

Data.event_text: 4 November  The French Boxing Federation announces its withdrawal from the International Boxing Association, citing a need to maintain its presence in the Olympics.

links.text: -"French boxing quits international body to keep its fighters at Olympics". France 24. 5 November 2024. Retrieved 2024-11-05.-

Data.event_text: 5 November  A court in Lille convicts 18 people, mostly from Iraq, for their role in smuggling migrants across the English Channel to the United Kingdom and sentences them to up to 15 years' imprisonment.

links.text: -"French court convicts 18 in a major trial that casts light on the deadly migrant-smuggling trade". Associated Press. 5 November 2024. Retrieved 2024-11-05.-

Data.event_text: 14 November  The Académie Française releases the ninth edition of the Dictionnaire de l'Académie française, replacing its previous edition published in 1935.

links.text: -"France's new dictionary struggles to keep up with the times". BBC. 15 November 2024. Retrieved 2024-11-15.-

Data.event_text: 28 November  Authorities announce the arrest of 26 people and the seizure of 11 million euros in assets as part of an eight-month operation against a human trafficking network sending migrants from South Asia.

links.text: -"France arrests 26 as South Asian migrant trafficking ring smashed". France 24. 28 November 2024. Retrieved 29 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 29 November  France officially recognises the killing of up to 400 members of the Tirailleurs Sénégalais by the French Army in Thiaroye, present-day Senegal in 1944 as a massacre.

links.text: -"France admits colonial 'massacre', says Senegal's leader". BBC. 29 November 2024. Retrieved 29 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 1 December  A bus crashes into a cliff near Porte-Puymorens, killing two people and injuring 33 others.

links.text: -"A bus crashed near a ski resort in southern France killing 2 people and injuring at least 33". Associated Press. December 2024. Retrieved 2 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 4 December  Michel Barnier becomes the first prime minister of France to be removed in a no-confidence vote since 1962, following a motion filed by far-left MPs and supported by the National Rally.

links.text: -"French political impasse deepens after government ousted in no-confidence vote". France 24. 4 December 2024. Retrieved 5 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 7 December  Notre-Dame de Paris reopens to the public following renovations prompted by the 2019 fire.

links.text: -"Notre-Dame Cathedral reopens five years after devastating blaze". Al Jazeera. 7 December 2024. Retrieved 2024-12-08.-

Data.event_text: 13 December  President Macron appoints MoDem leader François Bayrou as prime minister.

links.text: -"Macron names centrist Bayrou as French PM in bid to end political instability". BBC. 13 December 2024. Retrieved 13 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: Cyclone Chido makes landfall over Mayotte, killing at least 39 people.

links.text: -"At least 11 dead after cyclone hits Mayotte". BBC. 15 December 2024. Retrieved 15 December 2024.-
-"Cyclone death toll in Mayotte rises to 39". France 24. 25 December 2024. Retrieved 25 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: Quintuple murder near Dunkirk - Five people are killed in separate shootings in Loon-Plage and Wormhout. A suspect is arrested on suspicion of committing both incidents.

links.text: -"Five dead after shootings in northern France". BBC. 15 December 2024. Retrieved 15 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 15 December  Pope Francis arrives in Ajaccio to undertake the first papal visit to Corsica.

links.text: -"Pope Francis makes 1st papal visit to France's Corsica awash in expressions of popular piety". Associated Press. 15 December 2024. Retrieved 15 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 18 December  The Court of Cassation upholds the conviction of former president Nicolas Sarkozy for corruption and influence peddling after attempting to bribe a magistrate during a separate legal case against him.

links.text: -"France's highest court upholds corruption conviction of former president Nicolas Sarkozy". Associated Press. 18 December 2024. Retrieved 18 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 19 December  Mazan rapes Dominique Pelicot and 50 others are convicted of raping Pelicot's then wife, Gisèle Pelicot. Dominique is sentenced to the maximum penalty of 20 years imprisonment.

links.text: -"Gisèle Pelicot's ex-husband found guilty of rapes, sentenced to 20 years in prison in France". Associated Press. 19 December 2024. Retrieved 19 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 20 December  Eight people are convicted for the murder of Samuel Paty in 2020.

links.text: -"Eight convicted over beheading of teacher Samuel Paty in Paris". The Guardian. 20 December 2024. Retrieved 21 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 December  The European Pressurized Reactor, the largest nuclear reactor in France, begins commercial operations at the Flamanville Nuclear Power Plant in Normandy.

links.text: -"France's most powerful nuclear reactor finally comes on stream". France 24. 20 December 2024. Retrieved 22 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 23 December  President Macron presents the Bayrou government.

links.text: -"France has a new government. Now it must fix the budget while avoiding collapse". Associated Press. 24 December 2024. Retrieved 2024-12-24.-

Data.event_text: 29 December  Three migrants die in a suspected maritime incident in the English Channel off the coast of Sangatte.

links.text: -"3 die off northern France coast in Channel crossing attempt". Associated Press. 29 December 2024. Retrieved 2024-12-29.-
